21  package org.opencastproject.external.common;
22  
23  import static java.lang.String.format;
24  
25  import com.entwinemedia.fn.data.json.JValue;
26  import com.entwinemedia.fn.data.json.SimpleSerializer;
27  
28  import java.net.URI;
29  
30  import javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType;
31  import javax.ws.rs.core.Response;
32  import javax.ws.rs.core.Response.Status;
33  
34  /**
35   * A utility class for creating responses from the external api.
36   */
37  public final class ApiResponseBuilder {
38  
39    private static final String APPLICATION_PREFIX = "application/";
40  
41    private ApiResponseBuilder() {
42  
43    }
44  
45    public static Response notFound(String message, Object... args) {
46      return Response.status(Status.NOT_FOUND).entity(format(message, args)).type(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN_TYPE).build();
47    }
48  
49    public static Response serverError(String message, Object... args) {
50      return Response.serverError().entity(format(message, args)).type(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN_TYPE).build();
51    }
52  
53    /**
54     * Class that handles Json responses for the external API.
55     */
56    public static class Json {
57  
58      private static final String JSON_SUFFIX = "+json";
59      /** The serializer to use to serialize json content. **/
60      private static final SimpleSerializer serializer = new SimpleSerializer();
61  
62      /**
63       * Create an ok json response for the external api
64       *
65       * @param version
66       *          The version that was requested for the api
67       * @param body
68       *          The body of the response.
69       * @return The new {@link Response}
70       */
71      public static Response ok(ApiVersion version, String body) {
72        // FIXME: This does not make sense. Sending content type 'application/json' for a plain string?
73        // Maybe, when a new major release happens, wrap the string with a JSON object.
74        // See MH-12798: The External API should consistently return JSON strings
75        return Response.ok(body, APPLICATION_PREFIX + version.toExternalForm() + JSON_SUFFIX).build();
76      }
77  
78      /**
79       * Create an ok json response for the external api
80       *
81       * @param acceptHeader
82       *          The accept header string that was sent by the client.
83       * @param body
84       *          The body of the response.
85       * @return The new {@link Response}
86       */
87      public static Response ok(String acceptHeader, String body) {
88        final ApiVersion version = ApiMediaType.parse(acceptHeader).getVersion();
89        return ok(version, body);
90      }
91  
92      /**
93       * Create an ok json response for the external api
94       *
95       * @param version
96       *          The version that was requested for the api
97       * @param json
98       *          The json body of the response.
99       * @return The new {@link Response}
100      */
101     public static Response ok(ApiVersion version, JValue json) {
102       return Response.ok(serializer.toJson(json), APPLICATION_PREFIX + version.toExternalForm() + JSON_SUFFIX).build();
103     }
104 
105     /**
106      * Create an ok json response for the external api
107      *
108      * @param acceptHeader
109      *          The accept header string that was sent by the client.
110      * @param json
111      *          The json body of the response.
112      * @return The new {@link Response}
113      */
114     public static Response ok(String acceptHeader, JValue json) {
115       final ApiVersion version = ApiMediaType.parse(acceptHeader).getVersion();
116       return ok(version, json);
117     }
118 
119     /**
120      * Create a created json response for the external api
121      *
122      * @param acceptHeader
123      *          The accept header string that was sent by the client.
124      * @param location
125      *          The location
126      * @param json
127      *          The json body of the response.
128      * @return The new {@link Response}
129      */
130     public static Response created(String acceptHeader, URI location, JValue json) {
131       final ApiVersion version = ApiMediaType.parse(acceptHeader).getVersion();
132       return created(version, location, json);
133     }
134 
135     /**
136      * Create a created json response for the external api
137      *
138      * @param version
139      *          The version that was requested for the api
140      * @param location
141      *          The location
142      * @param json
143      *          The json body of the response.
144      * @return The new {@link Response}
145      */
146     public static Response created(ApiVersion version, URI location, JValue json) {
147       return Response.created(location).entity(serializer.toJson(json))
148               .type(APPLICATION_PREFIX + version.toExternalForm() + JSON_SUFFIX).build();
149     }
150 
151     /**
152      * Create a conflict json response for the external api
153      *
154      * @param version
155      *          The version that was requested for the api
156      * @param json
157      *          The json body of the response.
158      * @return The new {@link Response}
159      */
160     public static Response conflict(ApiVersion version, JValue json) {
161       return Response.status(Status.CONFLICT).entity(serializer.toJson(json))
162           .type(APPLICATION_PREFIX + version.toExternalForm() + JSON_SUFFIX).build();
163     }
164   }
165 }
